Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can identify and draw two different habitats, one on land and one in water, indicating where they are located (e.g., playground, forest, pond, stream).
The student can draw and label different kinds of plants in each habitat (e.g., trees, grasses, bushes, flowering plants).
The student can draw and label different kinds of animals in each habitat (e.g., lizards, squirrels, ants for land; fish, clams for water).
The student can show comparisons of the different types of living things found in each habitat by categorizing them or using arrows to indicate relationships.
The student can illustrate patterns in the diversity of plants and animals in the two habitats (e.g., more trees in a forest, more fish in a pond).
